content: #harmonscrunchie #harmonhalter hhaarrmmoonn ssccrruunncchhiiee jennifer olsen thedoubleknitters@gmail com @thedoubleknitters etsy - doubleknittersshop introduction thanks so much for downloading my pattern we decided to release #harmonscrunchie as a free pattern as the perfect accessory to the #harmonhalter both patterns were inspired by two things my love for motorsport and queen s gambit the iconic checkerboard design represents both the chequered flag of a race and a chess board the harmon scrunchie is a quick knit that can easily be made in an evening we hope you love knitting this pattern as much as we enjoyed designing it any questions regarding pattern help please e-mail us at thedoubleknitters@gmail com and we will try to respond as soon as possible <3 you will need - 3 25mm needles - either a set of double-pointed needles/very short circulars if you want to knit the scrunchie in the round or 3 25mm straight needles to knit the scrunchie flat - tapestry needle - stitch markers or safety pins - approximately 10g of dk weight main colour mc and 10g contrast colour cc yarn - a hair tie or elastic to make your own hair tie gauge 24 sts and 30 row to 4 10cm square in colorwork pattern using 3 25mm needles please share your finished makes with us on instagram - use the #harmonscrunchie and #harmonhalter tags so we can see them abbreviations k = knit p = purl mc = main colour cc = contrast colour bor = beginning of round instructions for the knit flat version ensure that at the end of each line you carry your floats by wrapping the unused yarn around the live yarn to prevent holes to knit the scrunchie flat cast on 90 stitches using mc for row 1-24 refer to chart a row 1 k5 using mc k4 using cc k4 using mc 10 times k4 using cc k1 using mc row 2 p1 using mc p4 using cc p4 using mc p4 using cc 10 times p5 using mc row 3 same as row 1 row 4 same as row 2 row 5 k1 using mc k4 using cc k4 using mc k4 using cc 10 times k5 using mc row 6 p5 using mc p4 using cc p4 using mc 10 times p4 using cc p1 using mc row 7 same as row 5 row 8 same as row 6 repeat these 8 row another two times you have now worked 24 row 6 full squares high row 25 k all stitches using mc cast off all stitches using mc and your preferred method to knit the scrunchie in the round cast on 88 stitches and join in the round place bor marker for rounds 1-24 refer to chart b round 1 2 3 and 4 k4 using mc k4 using cc 11 times round 5 6 7 and 8 k4 using cc k4 using mc 11 times repeat these 8 rounds another two times you have now worked 24 rounds 6 full squares
